intro: Ferula microloba, commonly known as the small-lobed ferula, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, hollow stems and feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in umbels, typical of its family, and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Its roots are fibrous and have been traditionally used in local herbal medicine. Ferula microloba is notable for its resilience to harsh climates and its role in supporting local biodiversity.
